intro: Dyssodia pinnata, commonly known as the featherleaf dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, feather-like leaves that give it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Dyssodia pinnata is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
